The answer is A: He cleaned the plate and reversed its image, then matched it to visuals of “Pauline Frederick” and the “Sleeping Fires” poster, concluding it was a printing plate for advertisements.

The individual in the audio describes his process of examining a metal plate he found while scouting. After cleaning the plate and reversing its image, he noticed a resemblance to images of Pauline Frederick and a poster from the "Sleeping Fires" series. This led him to believe that the plate may have been part of an advertisement or promotional material.

Answer: A: The detector produced a swirly 11-11 signal and he stated it turned out to be a V nickel; visually, the coin shows a hole/damage consistent with his comment that it looked like it had been shot.

The reason for this conclusion is based on the physical examination of the coin and the reading obtained from the metal detector. The individual describes hearing a swirly 11-11 signal from the detector, which typically indicates the presence of a V nickel. He also noticed damage to the coin, which appeared as if it had been shot. This led him to visually inspect the coin and confirm that it indeed had a bullet hole in it. Based on these observations, the individual concluded that the coin was a V nickel that had been shot.
